instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook Air 820-3435-B not turning on
threads.message: Hi all, rather than me try to type out an explanation, I've done a short video to show what I've done and my sticking points... Please help

threads.title: Macbook Air 820-3435-B not turning on
threads.message: Is PPVRTC_G3H shorted to ground? If it is and you have removed U1900 and all of the caps on that line, the CPU is dead.

threads.title: Macbook Air 820-3435-B not turning on
threads.message:
Yes it is, and yes I have - Damn :( 

Thank you for  confirming my thoughts

threads.title: Macbook Air 820-3435-B not turning on
threads.message:
Please post voltages and/or resistance to ground on basic points.
I don't plan to watch the video any time I have to post a reply...

We need to "see" available data in a fast way.

threads.title: Macbook Air 820-3435-B not turning on
threads.message:
Apologies, I felt it was a concise way to show you exactly what had been done

Basically, PPBUS_G3hot is 8.58V - so good
PP3V42 is good

The first point which falls down is  PPVRTC_G3H. There's no voltage here, and with U1900, and the 4 other caps on the line all removed from the board, the resistance to GND is 0.4 Ohms

threads.title: Macbook Air 820-3435-B not turning on
threads.message: Then PCH is bad; no other component remains there...
